title: US Senate deal on border security and Ukraine aid facing defeat
description: A bipartisan Senate deal intended to curb illegal crossings at the US border with Mexico faced almost certain defeat on Tuesday as Senate Republicans signalled their opposition. It will strand US President Joe Biden with no clear way to advance aid for Ukraine through Congress.

title: Bury North MP James Daly appointed deputy chair of Conservative Party
description: Bury North MP James Daly has been appointed a deputy chair of the Conservative Party. The role will focus on ‘campaigning’ as the country prepares for a general election later this year and his party faltering in opinion polls.

title: Drugs minister Elena Whitham quits due to post-traumatic stress
description: Drugs and Alcohol Policy Minister Elena Whitham has resigned from the Scottish government for health reasons. The SNP MSP for Carrick, Cumnock and Doon Valley said she was receiving treatment for post-traumatic stress. She said the condition had "greatly" affected her wellbeing.

title: Former Irish premier John Bruton dies aged 76
description: Former Irish premier John Bruton has died aged 76 following a long illness, his family has confirmed. Former Irish premier John Bruton has died aged 76 following a long illness, his family has confirmed. Mr Bruton was taoiseach from 1994 until 1997, and the leader of Fine Gael from 1990 to 2001.

title: Former taoiseach John Bruton remembered for ‘sensitivity and generous approach’
description: Former taoiseach John Bruton, who has died aged 76, has been remembered for bringing a “particular sensitivity and a generous approach” to the peace process. President Michael D Higgins, who served alongside the former Fine Gael leader in the Dáil and in cabinet, described him as a “deeply committed politician”.

title: Ethiopia's PM Abiy Ahmed says his country does not wish harm on Somalia
description: His comments in parliament came after Somalia accused landlocked Ethiopia of trying to annex part of its territory to gain access to the sea. Last month, Ethiopia struck a controversial deal with the breakaway republic of Somaliland.

title: Building trust during 2024 elections with live-blogging and fact-checking
description: Voters are heading to the ballot box at a time when they are turning away from the news. How do publishers give them reliable and accurate information?

title: Dame Esther Rantzen hails 'undeniable proof' Brits back assisted dying after huge victory
description: Since revealing she had signed up to Swiss suicide clinic Dignitas, Dame Esther has been inundated with messages from tens of thousands of people, some who lost sick loved ones in unimaginably cruel ways and others who, like her, simply want the right to end their lives as they see fit.

title: Who are your new local bobbies in Romsey?
description: Romsey and surrounding areas have been assigned new neighbourhood police officers - who are your local bobbies?

title: Scottish Government drugs minister Elena Whitham resigns for health reasons
description: The Scottish Government’s drugs and alcohol policy minister Elena Whitham has resigned for health reasons. The SNP minister said that over the last year she had “experienced a series of events leading to post traumatic stress”. She was appointed to her current role in Humza Yousaf’s Government in March last year.

title: Operation Menai Bridge: What happens when King Charles III dies?
description: The same protocol is now in place for King Charles III, who was the oldest British monarch at a coronation. Codenamed Operation Menai Bridge, the protocol for when Charles dies outlines the steps to be taken during the official period of mourning, the way his death will be announced publicly and the details of his funeral.

title: Welcome to the week of peak Taylor Swift, from the Grammys to Tokyo shows to the Super Bowl
description: This is Taylor Swift's week. It's hard to remember a star of Swift 's stature straddling so many roles, spanning so much of the globe, covering so many corners of the culture and doing so much of it in the spotlight she will have between Sunday's Grammy Awards and the coming Sunday's Super Bowl — with four Tokyo concerts in between.

description: The former prime minister told the Popular Conservatism launch event that ordinary Britons thought ‘the wokery that’s going on is nonsense’.

title: Nigel Farage: Conservatives facing 'extinction event' and he's aiming to replace them
description: The Reform Party politician spoke at the Conservatives' PopCon event about what he thinks will happen after the next election and ruled out joining the Tories. Sir Jacob Rees-Mogg, meanwhile, described his party as the "Duracell bunny of political life".

title: New home registrations fell by 44% last year, according to latest industry data
description: Industry figures reveal that new home registrations saw a steep drop of 44% in 2023 compared to the previous year.

title: Fuel poverty: as government support dries up, communities are taking action
description: Soaring heating expenses, stagnating or declining wages and poorly maintained housing have marred millions of lives with debt and poor health. Estimates suggest that 10% of excess winter deaths are directly attributable to fuel poverty and 21.5% to cold homes.

description: Liz Truss is back. The former prime minister has launched a campaign to "galvanize" Britain's "secret Conservatives" and fight back against the "left wing extremists" she claims have taken over Britain's institutions.

title: Trump not immune from prosecution in 2020 election case, US appeals court says
description: A federal appeals panel ruled on Tuesday that Donald Trump can face trial on charges that he plotted to overturn the results of the 2020 election, rejecting the former president’s claims that he is immune from prosecution.

title: Manhunt for Clapham chemical attack suspect Abdul Ezedi continues for sixth day
description: Fresh details have emerged about the sex crimes which led to Abdul Ezedi’s conviction as the manhunt for the suspect in a chemical attack continued for a sixth day. Police have offered a £20,000 reward to anyone with information leading to the 35-year-old’s arrest.

title: UK, France pitch rules to curb spyware abuse
description: The United Kingdom, France and allied countries on Tuesday called for international guidelines for the responsible use of spyware, in an effort to stop the hacking tools from running rampant.

title: The body overseeing South Wales Fire Service has been stripped of its responsibilities
description: The Welsh Government has intervened to hand oversight of South Wales' troubled fire service to four independent commissioners

title: Harry back in UK to reunite with the King after Charles’s cancer diagnosis
description: The Duke of Sussex has returned to the UK after making an emergency dash from the US to see the King following his cancer diagnosis. Harry flew in on Tuesday afternoon ready to be reunited with his father, despite the pair’s troubled relationship.

title: ‘We’ve failed to take on Left-wing extremists,’ Truss tells Popular Conservatism group launch – live updates
description: Rishi Sunak said he was “taken totally by surprise” by a £1,000 bet with Piers Morgan on the Government’s Rwanda policy. Mr Morgan bet the Prime Minister £1,000 to a refugee charity that Rwanda migrant deportation flights would not take off before the next general election.

title: Tories and Reform could merge after the election, Nigel Farage hints at PopCon
description: In an interview with i, Reform UK leader Richard Tice hinted that Mr Farage would not stand at the election, claiming it was his “gut instinct” that his party’s founder and honorary president would “campaign nationally” rather than seek to become an MP.

title: Hundreds of post offices ditch National Lottery sales under new licence
description: The National Lottery’s new operator has revealed that around 900 post offices across the UK will no longer sell draw tickets and scratchcards under the new 10-year licence.

title: Bolton's Helen Flanagan quits Cluedo 2 for medical reasons
description: Bolton actress Helen Flanagan has stepped down from the UK tour of murder mystery play Cluedo 2. Helen, who was set to play Miss Scarlett in the play, was “advised to withdraw” from the play due to medical reasons.
